intro: Phyllanthus stuhlmanii, commonly known as the Stuhlman's spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. The plant features small, clustered yellow flowers and has smooth, often succulent stems. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and usually have a waxy coating. It is adapted to survive in dry environments with minimal water requirements.
